text: Dámaso Domingo García Sánchez (7 February 1957 – 15 April 2020) was a Dominican baseball player. He was born in Moca. He is best known for his time spent at Major League Baseball's Toronto Blue Jays from 1980 to 1986. He also played in MLB for the New York Yankees (1978–1979), the Atlanta Braves (1987–1988) and the Montreal Expos (1989). He was also a two-time All-Star (1984, 1985). Before his professional baseball career, García was a footballer. He captained both Universidad Católica Madre y Maestra and the Dominican Republic national team. García died in San Pedro de Macorís on 15 April 2020 at the age of 63. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1955 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Atlanta Braves players Category:Dominican Republic baseball players Category:Caribbean footballers Category:Montreal Expos players Category:New York Yankees players Category:Toronto Blue Jays players
title: Dámaso García
